plt.style.use('default')
sns.set_style("dark")

def plot_count(feature, df, size=1):
    f, ax = plt.subplots(1,1, figsize=(6*size,8))
    total = float(len(df))
    g = sns.countplot(df[feature], order = df[feature].value_counts().index[:20], palette='Set3', edgecolor='k')
    g.set_title("Number and percentage of Songs composed in each Ragam",fontsize=15)
    g.set_ylabel("Number of Songs", fontsize=12)
    g.set_xlabel("Ragam", fontsize=13)
    if(size > 2):
        plt.xticks(rotation=90, size=8)
    for p in ax.patches:
        height = p.get_height()
        ax.text(p.get_x()+p.get_width()/2.,
                height + 3,
                '{:1.2f}%'.format(100*height/total),
                ha="center") 
    plt.show()

## ***Maestro Ilayaraja***
![](https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwODYzZDctZDMxNy00ZGY5LWIzMGYtMDNlZDFlYjdiMDNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjYwMDk5NjE@._V1_.jpg)

### **Introduction**
Widely regarded as one of the greatest Indian music composers of all time, **[Ilaiyaraaja](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ilaiyaraaja)**, is an Indian film composer, singer, songwriter, instrumentalist, orchestrator, conductor-arranger and lyricist who works in the Indian film industry, predominantly in Tamil and other languages including Telugu, Kannada, Malayalam, Marathi, Hindi and English.

* He is often referred to as **"maestro"**, amongst others by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, London.

* Reputed to be the world's most prolific composer, he has composed more than 7,000 songs, provided film scores for more than 1,000 movies and performed in more than 20,000 concerts.

* Being the first Asian to compose a full symphony, Ilaiyaraaja is known to have written the entire symphony in less than a month.

* In a 2013 poll conducted by CNN-IBN celebrating 100 years of Indian cinema, Ilaiyaraaja was voted as the all-time greatest film-music director of India.

* American world cinema portal "Taste of Cinema" placed him at the 9th position in its list of 25 greatest film composers in the history of cinema, the only Indian in the list.

* In 2003, according to an international poll conducted by BBC of more than half-a million people from 165 countries, his composition "Rakkamma Kaiya Thattu" from the 1991 film Thalapathi was voted fourth in the top 10 most popular songs of all time.

* One of his compositions was part of the playlist for the opening ceremony of the 2012 London Olympics.

* In 2010, he was awarded the Padma Bhushan, the third-highest civilian honour in India and the Padma Vibhushan in 2018, the second-highest civilian award by the government of India.
